module.title: toponymic namifications
module.p: Toponymic namifications are namifications which are also toponyms, i.e. they are (usually definite) common noun phrases used to name places (geographical entities).
Pre-specified toponymic namifications – An t-Àth Leathann Broadford, A’ Chomraich Applecross, An Agaidh Mhòr Aviemore
Post-specified toponymic namifications – Baile Bhòid Rothesay, Baile nan Granndach Grantown-on-Spey, Baile Ailein Balallan, Baile an t-Sealgair Hunterston, Baile Ùr an t-Slèibhe Newtonmore
Toponymic improper nouns – An Fhraing France, A’ Ghearmailt Germany, i.e. pre-specified toponymic namifications where the noun does not appear to be a common noun.
